Black Friday with Green Hosting: Hoster Labs Stops By From the North Pole! (2GB ipv6-only VPS for $1.50/mo!)

black friday, canada, hosterlabs November 27, 2020 @ 12:00 pm, by raindog308

Hoster Labs is right next door to Santa Claus up in the Great White North so naturally they are participating in our Black Friday!  And they’re bringing us some great, exclusive offers:

  • 1GB VPS for $0.99/month for the first five customers, $1.49 for everyone else
  • 2GB ipv6-only VPS for $1.50/month for the first ten customers or 99 cents/mo for ipv6-only ($3 for everyone else).  99 cents/mo for 2GB is pretty awesome!

Since both have limited quantities, act fast!

I wrote up the last offer for Hoster Labs and was really impressed by their focus on sustainability and green hosting.  They’re using 100% renewable energy and give 20% of profits to charity (see details on their site).

Here’s what they have to say about themselves:

“We are extremely proud to say that we have an excellent support service which is dedicated to our customers. We attempt to have a very good customer satisfaction. Some of our clients are just surprised with our support given our price. We have a lot of experience in technical support and virtualization. We know our stuff in IPv4 and IPv6 as well as anti-ddos protection and optimization. You have system administrators with vast knowledge as your technical support staff. Do not doubt to contact us, as we have your back as your service providers.

We are focused in several aspects; affordability, excellence in customer service and social responsibility. 
What do I mean with social responsibility? It means being conscious about our surroundings and understanding that money is not everything in this industry. We care about the environment and our society. We have planned to donate 20% of all our profit at the end of the year to several organizations described in our “about-us” page. At the end of the day, sustainable business models will perdure on the long run.
We offer good hardware, good customer support, and daily supervision of each and all vm’s. We communicate proactively with our customers to check how their service is going. We always try to mediate and know how they are doing. We often perceive issues due to our intensive monitoring before they are reported. So when our customer submits a ticket, we already on it.”

Their WHOIS is not public but they are a registered company in Mexico (Mexico RFC: COPJ010609CVA) and you can find their terms of service on their web site.  You can pay with Paypal, bank transfer, Stripe, and BitCoin.

Remember that the LEB wants to hear about your experiences, so if you try out Hosterlabs, please comment below!
